contents-list.explanation: not different
samples: He has lived in the same city all his life.

contents-list.explanation: a specific area of region of the world
samples: I've heard it's a good place to raise children.

contents-list.explanation: a track that is made by people or animals walking over the ground
samples: The path led down the hill.

contents-list.explanation: a large hole that was formed by natural processes in the side of a cliff or hill or under the ground.
samples: She took me by the hand and led me into the cave.

contents-list.explanation: causing horror
samples: A horrible accident happened in the street.

contents-list.explanation: an animal that has wings and a furry body like a mouse
samples: The tunnel is a place only a bat could love.

contents-list.explanation: a large and often dangerous sea fish with very sharp teeth
samples: Sharks were circling around our boat.

contents-list.explanation: a kind of insect that has a long thin body and brightly colored wings and that flies mostly during the day
samples: I shut my eyes and tried to see the butterfly.

contents-list.explanation: an animal that has wings and is covered with feathers
samples: A large bird flew overhead.

contents-list.explanation: a small usually gray whale that has a pointed nose.
samples: Dolphins move quickly in the water.

contents-list.explanation: a large bird that has very good eyesight and that kills other birds and animals for food
samples: Eagles use their powerful eyes to find food.

contents-list.explanation: A large brownish-yellow cat with black spots that lives in Asia and Africa
samples: The zoo has three leopards.

contents-list.explanation: a large usually white bird that lives on or near water and that has a very long and graceful neck
samples: We took some bread to feed the swans.

contents-list.explanation: an often very large animal that lives in the ocean and that is a mammal rather than a fish
samples: Blue whales are the largest and loudest animals in the world.

contents-list.explanation: a long, thin animal that has a soft body with no legs or bones and that often lives in the ground
samples: I often see worms in the garden.

contents-list.explanation: a small electric light that can be carried in your hand and that runs on batteries
samples: She flashed the torch into the dark room.

contents-list.explanation: a device that you hold up to your eyes and look through to see things that are far away
samples: The bird in that tree can be seen through a pair of binoculars.

contents-list.explanation: a small animal that has six legs and a body formed of three parts and that may have wings
samples: The picture book introduces flies, bees, and other insects.

contents-list.explanation: not tall
samples: He is short for his age.

contents-list.explanation: little in size
samples: They live in a small house.
